reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for two nights while visiting family.
reviews.title: Noisy

reviews.text: Well first the good stuff.
reviews.title: Standard Premier Inn

reviews.text: Its a bog standard Premier Inn. usual room, clean comfortable and well appointed.
reviews.title: 5 night work trip!

reviews.text: Breakfast was good value for money. We had the full cooked option.
reviews.title: Business stay - poor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were smiley and chatty.
reviews.title: Wonderful Service

reviews.text: Myself and friends booked into the premier inn whilst we were down for a sporting event. From the moment we got their we were very warmly welcomed by Kim on reception. we had arrived particularly early, but our bags were stored for us whilst we waited in the bar for our rooms to become available. The bar has a really warm and frinedly atmosphere and great choice of good food. Drink prices are super cheap too. we spent saturday evening in the bar and had such a blast. there was a Dj playing and all the staff were friendly and helpful. this is the perfect hotel for a weekend away with friends, cheap and cheerful with excellent staff. Will definately be back.
reviews.title: Top Notch!

reviews.text: A massive thanks to all the staff that made our stay so enjoyable :)
reviews.title: not the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: very clean nice staff but needs updating looks very old rooms are big but it looks like the 80s pub next store ok you get what you pay for . meals are a good price but basic . if want a great premier inn go to widnes first class best by far .
reviews.title: SUPER !!!!

reviews.text: Stayed here again overnight for an easter break !!! Fab, Clean, Warm (as it was coldest easter on record), friendly staff and free easter egg in our room !! Bonus havin the Hungry Horse pub next to Hotel ! Breakfast is DEFFO worth the money !!!! ( If you like a cooked )
reviews.title: Good enough.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stay here about four times a year. It's very convenient for the nearby Clatterbridge hospital, where I occasionally work - useful if anyone else needs accommodation while visiting this place.
reviews.title: Best Premier So Far

reviews.text: Just what I expect from a premier Inn. Simple rooms, comfortable bed, spotless bathroom and a terrific breakfast. Only slight complaint I found the wifi very difficult to connect to when paying by credit card, solved by buying a voucher at reception but it did mean I paid twice. A pity the helpline is 10p a minute, but otherwise great
reviews.title: Simple but excellent

reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights. The first night was fine (although we were very tired) but the second night was terrible. I was woken at least 4 times during the night from outside noise. There is considerable flight traffic from the nearby airport and very heavy road noise from the adjoining busy road. However, this would have been ok but there was a constant loud "humming noise" from what appeared to be a nearby factory or plant of some sort. When I got up (at 6am) and went outside the noise was clearly audible and I spoke to another guest who said it had been going all night. I mentioned it to the receptionist on duty but she said that she didn't know of any neighbouring properties that would generate such a noise. In the end I made her come outside and she did (reluctantly) agree that she could hear it. We were offered a quieter room. The receptionist also said that the busy road is mentioned on their web site but I checked and cannot find any mention of this, so Premier Inn need to rectify this. All that said, apart from the terrible nights sleep from the noise, the hotel itself is what you expect from this Chain, the room was a good size, spotlessly clean and does what it says on the tin. The Hungry Horse restaurant is very good value for money, but is quite "lively", although this aspect did not affect the enjoyment of our stay.
reviews.title: Very noisy meant interrupted nights sleep

reviews.text: The location was very convenient with ample and safe parking. If you could match travel lodge prices I will use more often for private stay with my wife. Having a Pub and restaurant next to the hotel was useful and convenient. Having driven nearly five and half hours you do not want drive any more to find a place to eat late in the evening.
reviews.title: very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a standard Premier Inn offering the usual good value. Apart from one or two minor plumbing foibles the room was very good. The Hungry Horse restaurant next door is very nice indeed, very good service and friendly staff. One thing to watch is that the hotel and the restaurant have separate, adjacent car parks that do not interconnect and the signage is poor in terms of making this clear. We initially went into the restaurant car park by mistake and then had difficulty finding the hotel reception.
reviews.title: Standard Premier Inn -- ie pretty good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A Premier Inn is a Premier Inn and this one is generally a good example. All the staff were friendly and helpful.The room was standard with huge double bed (two large singles together) and spacious enough with two armchairs and plenty of storage. The bathroom was spotlessly clean and the servicing of the room was very efficient. Premier are very family friendly and we were impressed by the care and attention that was shown to the families staying while we were there. Breakfasts were generous and well cooked. I would happily stay again and encourage others to stay.
reviews.title: Premier Inn doing what it does well ... but

reviews.text: The Premier Travel Inn in Bromborough provides a decent place to stay at a reasonable price. The rooms were good sized and clean with comfortable beds. The heating system worked well and was easily controllable. The staff were pleasant. There's plenty of parking. The hotel is attached to a pub/restaurant. We didn't have dinner there, but the breakfast was pretty good. One annoyance was the lack of telephones in any of the rooms and even the pay phone in the stairwel had intentionally been taken out of service. It's a nonsmoking hotel, but the hallways had a heavy cigarette smell. We stayed there over a weekend and the Saturday night was pretty noisy. Just people talking and laughing loudly, but the sound really seemed to carry. Sunday night was very quiet.
reviews.title: Not bad

reviews.text: Stayed the night before filming a Wedding at near by Port Sunlight. Couldn't fault anything, staff were all friendly and polite and breakfast was very good. I also enjoyed the atmosphere in the adjoing Hungary Horse pub.
reviews.title: Very good value

reviews.text: First of all, there is plenty of free parking right outside the hotel. Small Reception, but staff friendly and efficient. Room is excellent. Well furnished (for a basic hotel) with massive bed, chair, tv and bathroom Tea making facilites. Room 31 overlooks one of the pub entrances. Unforunately, as it was probably the hottest day of the year so far and a Friday night, a lot of people were drinking late and rowdy when they left - up to about 1am. There is also a lot of road noise (what do you expect, it is on the main A41). Overall, I would recommend this Premier Inn and stay again.
reviews.title: Great rooms and service, noisy pub

reviews.text: We stayed here over Spring Bank holiday for two nights. We stayed in room 18 and did not suffer any problems with noise at all, even though this room is situated above the Reception entrance. We can only say positive things about our stay as there was nothing whatsoever to complain about. The room is the same as every other Premier Inn (no surprises there!) and was very clean and everything in working order. Breakfast was delicious, good choices and served in the adjoining pub The Royal Oak, our daughter ate for free which is always a bonus. We also ate in the pub one evening which is one of the Hungry Horse chain, so again fairly standard food here but good value for money.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

reviews.text: The main thing both my husband and I commented on about this hotel and pub, was how friendly and helpful the staff are. They seemed genuinely interested in making sure we had a good stay. A credit to the company.
reviews.title: Happy times

reviews.text: One thing to mention is there are two car parks here, one for the pub and one for the hotel on opposite sides of the building. Make sure you park at the hotel side near Reception, although you can walk through the pub but not ideal.
reviews.title: Total comfort
